body: On OpenBSD there's no nsswitch.conf file.  Instead, host resolution database ordering is controlled by the "lookup" option in /etc/resolv.conf.  E.g., "lookup bind file" (the default) means to check DNS, then fall back to /etc/hosts.  There are also no "criterion" like in nsswitch.conf files, just a list of databases.  See http://www.openbsd.org/cgi-bin/man.cgi/OpenBSD-current/man5/resolv.conf.5
